_header: O Lord almighty blessed thou be
Note: A direct translation of the Latin which precedes in Oxford, Bodleian Library Hatton 73 (SC 4119); English prose versions occur in London, British Library Harley 1706, ff. 17v and 84.
_description: A prayer of confession — three 8-line and one 4-line stanzas

Lam344.First Lines:
Lorde allemyghty blessud thu beThat hast me formed and
                    redemyd…
Lam344.Last Lines:
…Late thy pytee sprynge and spredeeAnd graunt the nevyre here
                    after y do amysse
Lam344.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 216-17.
